caption: Table 1: Simulation parameters of the matrix-weighted consensus model (7).
description: This table presents the parameters used in two simulations of a matrix-weighted consensus model with heterogeneous time delays.  The model is identified as equation (7) in the paper.  Each simulation involves three distinct time delays (τ₁, τ₂, τ₃) applied to different subsets of edges in the network.  Simulation 1 uses smaller delays (0.05, 0.10, 0.15) while Simulation 2 uses larger delays (0.05, 0.10, 0.20). The purpose of the table is to specify the exact time delay values used for comparison and analysis.
section: A.5.1 Matrix-weighted consensus models with time delays

caption: Table 1: Simulation parameters of the matrix-weighted consensus model (7).
description: This table shows the parameters used in two simulations of the matrix-weighted consensus model with heterogeneous delays.  The model uses three different time delays (τ₁, τ₂, τ₃) which are applied to different sets of edges in the network. Simulation 1 uses delays of 0.1, 0.2, and 0.3 seconds, respectively, while Simulation 2 uses delays of 0.1, 0.2, and 0.35 seconds.
section: A.5.1 Matrix-weighted consensus models with time delays
